kingdom.quote: All roads leads to rome. (well... they actually came from there)
kingdom.long_description: They learned how to survive the hard way, surrounded by enemies and raiders awaiting to strike and pillage their cities. Now, armies around the known world are trying to find a way to stop them.
kingdom.post_selection_description: , a refined society of scholars, artists and specialist in war.

coast.description: Rocks and mountains descending into the sea. Default home of the Fortuna Romanorum.

spring.description: Spring in the Coast is the mildest season, lasting two months. Occasional rainfall keeps the soil fresh while pleasant sunshine brings new life to all plants and creatures.

summer.description: Summer in the Coast is the hottest season, lasting five months. It is dry and not very windy with little rainfall, which usually comes together with violent storms.

autumn.description: Autumn in the Coast is the harvest season, lasting two months. Plants enjoy their portion of rain after the dry summer while the skies darken with rain clouds before drier, windy winter.

winter.description: Winter in the Coast is a windy season, lasting three months. It is also quite dry, making plants and animals exhausted by hot summer and stormy autumn wait for spring rainfall.

serene_mind.description:
Are all of our daily mishaps worth worrying about? We should focus on the big picture instead. Diligence and Curiosity are increased.
  • Crafting quality is quite increased
  • The hearthling's mood is quite increased

serene_mind.tooltip: Can anything bring a thought more refreshing than a goblet of wine?

windy_dry.description:
The air is dry as the winds howl across the lands.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Noticeably reduced humidity levels.

windy_chilly_dry.description:
The air is dry and cold as the winds howl across the lands.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Noticeably reduced humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.

cloudy_hot.description:
Skies may be dark, but accumulated heat is still unbearable.
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too hot to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are affected by the heat.

amberstone.bonus_description: All citizens gain Amberstone Aura buff.

bulletin_message.000: Hi there. I see you are settling near and i have to warn you about the dangers in this area. But don't worry, you are not alone. We are here to cover each other's back. we'll be back tomorrow to trade. In the meantime take this as a sign of trust:
bulletin_message.001: Friend or foe? Here we protect our kind so be careful about what you do. Keep your hands clean and we will gladly include you in our friend list. I don't really trust you yet but our elders requested us to bring you some stuff:
bulletin_message.002: We are glad to see a new outpost in this areas. There are dangers everywhere and we are not enough to keep them at bay. We have to go now but will return to help you in your efforts around here so in the meantime we will leave some goods to get you started:
bulletin_message.003: The lands are full of bandits and thiefs yet you want to settle here anyway... I like it. I want to see how far you go. Anyway, the senate sent a cart of supplies for you:
bulletin_message.004: The senate welcomes you, little town. We are the envoys of the Herminia gens. They are eager to sponsor your settlement with supplies in order to expand our frontiers to the north:

simple_message.choice_000: Were the frontlines a good idea?

bulletin_message.000: Well, in addition to being distinguished as an official township, you will gain recognition from traders and travelers from all over Hearth. We shall also offer you architectural blueprints we've collected through our trades with other Rayya's Children settlements.

The Church of Rayya, more commonly known as Her Mystery, can designate an outpost as an official Church waypoint. In order to be eligible, your town must provide a shrine where travelers and weary wanderers can give offerings to Monkey and pay homage to Guildmother Rayya.

shrine_reqs.choice_001: How else can I gain renown?

bulletin_message.000: Well, getting to the point, I believe we can both benefit from an agreement of sorts. We at the Africanus Agency strive to create the most comprehensive maps of Hearth, and so we wish to detail any notable establishments and outposts such as yours. With your permission, of course!

details.choice_000: What do I get in return?

bulletin_message.000: Great! Let us get this process rolling then. First of all, how would you like to be known? We can put you on the map as a place renowned for its: Trading Post, Shrine of Her Mystery, or Silk Road.
How would you like to be known? We can put you on the map as a place renowned for its: Trading Post, Shrine of Her Mystery, or Silk Road.
Greetings, friends of [str(i18n_data.town_name)]! It's been some time since we've last visited this outpost. Looks like you've been making good use of the starting supplies we delivered.

In order to gain renown in the Silk Road, your town must engage in trades with visitors from faraway lands and thus gain access to a variety of goods that would be otherwise unobtainable in your area.

exotic_goods_reqs.choice_001: How else can I gain renown?

bulletin_message.000: Monkey be with you, [str(i18n_data.town_name)]! I shall leave you a bird, so you may summon me to evaluate your progress!

Why, our cartographers are making preparations for the next printing iteration of the Senate Map of Hearth. While we at Senate are known for trade, we also pride ourselves for the accuracy and utility of our maps. Settlements and routes from across the world are depicted in the finest detail.

In order to gain renown as a Trading Post for the Masses, it is important that your city be a welcoming place for traders and travelers to visit and trade goods amongst each other. I shall give your potter a recipe; build a monument which can act as a grand and inviting display at the heart of your settlement.

trading_post_reqs.choice_001: How else can I gain renown?

bulletin_message.000: Excellent! In addition to an appropriate monument, your town will also need to have accumulated a certain level of worth. I shall leave the requirements with you, should you wish to consult with them again, or should a different path come to appeal more than your initial chosen road.

I will give your potter a sacred shrine recipe, passed down from Her Mystery's most Elite Officers. They say the ingredients are found in ancient structures and loot chests; build the monument and I shall return to verify if it meets the specifications of the Church Elders.

I will give your potter a recipe. You can obtain the ingredients from traveling merchants and trading caravans, but note that not many travelers carry them. Build a monument that incorporates these ingredients to demonstrate your excellence in trading Silk Road.

bulletin_message.00: As the outpost founding forms are filled, i shall begin my journey back to the capital.

Once you have made your choice, please record them on the provided forms and send them back.

Jupiter keep you,
Aelia Herminia,
Head of the Roman Senate
Ave settlement of rome. I bring you a message from the senate:

Dear Settler [str(i18n_data.town_serial_number)],

Thank you for volunteering to establish a new outpost so far to the North! We here at the Roman Senate are delighted that you chose us to facilitate your founding.

Once the paperwork is in order, an official delegation party led by Commander Lucius Africanus will start a new route to your outpost.

To start, in order for us to enter your outpost into the republic ledger, you must choose a name, as well as a Standard.

The Standard declares to the rest of the known world the purpose behind you settling down, though we have found that it is even more effective at inspiring an outpost's own people.
They also sent this bag full of coins, as an incentive for your Outpost Foundation.
Hi litte village, good to see you again. I bring a new letter from Aelia Herminia.

Conversely, we expect you to start considering the next step in your Outpost's evolution. Although most of the frontline outposts choose the military way, we think other approaches to prosperity are equally valuable to the Senate, and it is always up to the Outpost themselves to make that decision.

Jupiter keep you!
Aelia Herminia
Roman Senate


P.S. A small gift for you, for good luck

Congratulations on your Founding!

Your Outpost is now officially in the Senate ledger, and I trust that you're well on your way to becoming our primary contact in the region!

To help you achieve this worthy goal, we'll be directing more of our trading partners towards your outpost in the days to come, and encouraging those leaving their caravans to head to [str(i18n_data.town_name)].

The Senate salutes you little settlement. You have proved your worthy as a frontline outpost of our expanding republic, reason why we will proclaim this town as the 'Great Gate to the North'.

You have to choose a Hearth to represent your town before this proclamation becomes official.

As you know, Hearths have been the cornerstone of Settlements since the beginning of our culture.

If not for their glow, we, the roman people, would have never made it to this point, and our beliefs would have been lost in history. The type of Hearth also says much about what a Settlement values.
For instance, a Hearth of Cheer is for those who believe that a town's value is found in being a happy home for its citizens.
Finally, a Hearth of Glory is for those who believe that there comes a time when negotiations no longer suffice, and the land has to be protected by force.
A Hearth of Makers, on the other hand, is for those who believe that a town's value is its work, and that its work is best measured in gold.
Choose wisely as you won't be able to change it.

Of course, with our backing, everyone will know that when you call something a 'Masterwork', you mean it! It's in the bylaws, after all.

I have no doubt that traders will soon be going out of their way to pay your Town a visit. I'd expect lots of company!

Alright, enough with all this business talk - I'm going to find a spry young thing and get to dancing!

What? You're only as old as you act!

(Adia nods, mumbling to herself. 'Hmm... yes, I suppose this will do nicely, nicely indeed.')

Oh! Children, you have chosen well to sign on as part of the Merchant Council's network, and we are certainly glad to have you!

msg1.bulletin_title: Adia Radie leans in, examining the Monument

bulletin_message.00:
Ha! I guess that's true!

So, we scrounged up some weapon designs from dusty old tomes that the Rayya's Mystery folks had stashed away - I brought some copies along to give out to your crafters, so they can try and work out how to put 'em together.

msg2.choice_000: I'm sure they'll figure it out!

bulletin_message.00:
No doubt!

Alright, I've been on my feet all day, so I'm gonna go grab a bowl or a slice of something! Congratulations!

Wow, I bet this can be seen from miles off! Those goblins will be running scared before long!

I'm so glad you decided to sign up with us - there's not too many of us Painted Dogs yet, but we're growing fast because of Towns like you!

Each morning, this blessed Shrine will bestow a little of Her Mystery upon each of you.

Ponder it. Take that curiosity out into the world with you as you trade, or explore, or welcome strangers into your Town hoping to overhear some tantalizing new bit of information.
Of course, we at the Temple will expect a regular report of any goings on. That can wait, though - for now, it's time for all of us to eat, drink, and be merry!

Monkey keep you, sisters and brothers. What a suitable shrine you've built!

I especially enjoy the key hanging from Monkey's tail - what lock is it meant for? What could be hidden behind that lock? Truly, a mystery!

bulletin_message.00:
Hello, [str(i18n_data.town_name)]!

I'm so glad to finally get to see your Settlement with my own eyes! I thought Naryal's accounts of its splendor were exaggerations, but I see now that they may actually have been understatements!

Well, let's move on to business. Here are the potential sponsors I mentioned in my last letter. Please take a moment to hear what they have to say.

Jupiter keep you, brothers and sisters! I am Caecilia, a High Priestess of the Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus. We are meant to extend our beliefs to the whole world. One way we work towards this is by sponsoring towns here, far from the heart of the roman territories.

In return for our sponsorship, we typically ask a Settlement to build a Shrine to Jupiter, to serve as a spiritual guide in this world of chaos. Once the shrine is blessed, it will spread its magical effects among your populace, empowering them in strange and mysterious ways.

Dedicating a Shrine of Jupiter will grant your townsfolk a random daily buff. Try your luck!

Come here, my brothers! I'm Vespasianus, the leader of the Tribunus Plebis or Voices of the People, and an admirer of this budding little Settlement of yours. So efficient! So promising! So helpfull towards its people! I'm also amazed by the resources you are giving to our people, making everyones life more comfortable.

Vespasianus produces a handful of hard candy from his robes and distributes them among the group.

As you know, the Roman Forum is the main sponsor of our Towns, so I'm sure you aren't surprised to see me here. We would love to have you join the Council - I think your Settlement can produce and export some of the finest goods our people have to offer, and keep the tradition of excellency that we are known for.

Dedicating a Trader Monument will grant the ability to create Masterwork-quality furniture and decorations, which are considerably better than those of Excellent quality.

Hey! I am Cornelius Maximus! You probably haven't heard of me yet, but I'm the leader of the Praetorian Guard, as away to say, the police of the capital and also it's elite defenders. Your people seems strong enough to be able to join our ranks but also to help us to learn from our neighbors and prepare our military force.

We heard that the far east have some strange yet powerful weapons that could even keep the biggest monsters at bay. That's why we'd like you open trade with them by building a Silk Road Monument. Of course we will also share some of our latest weapon and armor schematics.

Dedicating the Silk Road Monument will grant you recipes for new, highest-tier weapons and open trade with the east.

So! Now you've met everyone, and my job as the facilitator is coming to a close. I don't want to influence your choice, but I can assure you they're all very powerful and can help your town achieve its full potential.

I'll leave the plans for each of the shrines and whatnot with your crafters.

It's been a pleasure visiting, and I'm looking forward to seeing you again at the dedication ceremony!

I am currently making arrangements to finally visit your Settlement myself, and when I do, I will be bringing along several individuals who have expressed interest in sponsoring up and coming Settlements like yours. These are highly regarded members of our society, so be sure to have your best teaware ready!

Jupiter keep you!
Aelia Herminia
Roman Senate

Dear [str(i18n_data.town_name)]-ites,

I have received many reports from our trading partners singing your Settlement all kinds of praises. I am so glad that our investment in your Outpost is bearing fruit so quickly!

As you may remember from our contract, the final service we offer any Outpost under our guidance is to connect them to some prominent members of Rayya's Children society, who can help them cross that final bridge to becoming a Town.
Hey little town, log time no see. The Senate is proud of your settlement and wants to promote you!

bulletin_message.00:
Wonderful, wonderful! Your Town certainly does the Senate name proud!

Thank you for throwing such a nice reception for me and our guests.

This monument we're celebrating about is special, by the way - a Town's founding imbues a special sort magic into it.

Building more statues and such can serve decorative purposes, but they won't have the same sort of glow, if you know what I mean.

(Yap! Yap!)

Yes, yes, Arke, I know, it's time to go.

I'd love to stay longer, but there's other, less self-sufficient Caravans out there that need my attention.

Congratulations on all your success, and thanks for not having ever made too much paperwork for me.

Jupiter keep you, friend! Now that our existing contract is resolved, we'd like to remind you that the Roman Senate is always open for new settlements!

In fact, since this collaboration went so well, if you'd like to establish another town, we'd be happy to sponsor a larger caravan that can carry a few of your citizens from here, as well as some extra goods and records. Just let us know when you're ready!

Re-embarking allows you to carry over up to 3 citizens, 10 items, and all your unlocked recipes when starting a new town.
A messenger of the Roman Senate approaches, carring news from the capital:

From the Roman Senate to all settlements:

Following the recent defeats against our foes, our people is lacking the capability to field armies for the defense of our lands.

Our battle tactics also proved to be obsolete for the new challenges we are facing.

This means that we must reorganize our military structure to flexibilize and adapt to changes.

To help you out we have sent the newest equipment blueprints to prepare each garrison.

If you qualify we will also promote your military leader and send a standar to carry into battle.

New blueprints available for the Blacksmith:

* Gladius.

* Legionary Helmet.

* Legionary Armor.
bulletin_message.01:
New blueprints available for the Carpenter:

* Legionary Shield.

bulletin_title.01: The Carpenter has unlocked the Blacksmith Gladius, Legionary Helmet & Armor
bulletin_title.02: The Carpenter has unlocked the Legionary Shield

bulletin_message.00: One of your warriors have proven his worth as a leader. For this we hereby promote him as a Centurion
Through your successful patrols and defense measures, the borders of the Empire have been secured. The Senate honors you with a promotion to legat.
Your garrison have proof to be the finest in the northern frontier. As a reward we will allow you to carry the standar of the Republican Guard
